page.title: 03AUSTIN ROVER 2
page.content: encouraging to young people, saying that they would not recommend them to start work there. On the other hand 43% said that they would. Approximately l000 cars are made every 24 hours for 5 days each week. It takes about 30 hours to make a medium-sized car like the Austin Maestro. Various parts of the car, the engine and gear-box for example, come to the factory already assembled. The "30 hours" relates to the assembly of all the different components either manufactured at Cowley or received in a manufactured state from a supplying company. The models made at Cowley are the Rover SDI range, the Maestro range and the Montego range. Since their introduction in l973, l982 and l984 respectively production has reached 234,000, 236,000 amd l28,000.
